intro: Lettsomia pallida, commonly known as the pale lettsomia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pale pink to white in color. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Lettsomia pallida is primarily grown as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and unique foliage.
